xxl.core.cursors
Interface MetaDataCursor<E,M>

Type Parameters:
E - the type of the elements returned by this iteration.
M - the type of the given meta data object.
All Superinterfaces:
Cursor<E>, java.util.Iterator<E>, MetaDataProvider<M>
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractMetaDataCursor, AdvTupleCursor, Aggregator, CrossTableCursor, GroupAggregator, GroupAggregator, InputStreamMetaDataCursor, LoggingMetaDataCursor, Mapper, MergeSorter, NestedLoopsDifference, NestedLoopsDistinct, NestedLoopsGrouper, NestedLoopsIntersection, NestedLoopsJoin, Orenstein, Orenstein.FloatPointKPEzCodeMapper, Projection, Renaming, ResultSetMetaDataCursor, Sampler, Selection, SortBasedDifference, SortBasedDistinct, SortBasedDivision, SortBasedGrouper, SortBasedIntersection, SortMergeJoin, Union
public interface MetaDataCursor<E,M>
extends Cursor<E>, MetaDataProvider<M>

A metadata-cursor realizes a cursor additionally providing metadata. It extends the interface Cursor and MetaDataProvider. So the main difference between a regular cursor and a metadata-cursor lies in the provision of the getMetaData method, which returns metadata information about the elements this metadata-cursor delivers. The return value of the getMetaData method can be an arbitrary kind of metadata information, e.g., relational metadata information, therefore it is defined as a generic type.

When using a metadata-cursor, it has to be guaranteed, that all elements contained in this metadata-cursor refer to the same metadata information. That means, every time getMetaData is called on a metadata-cursor, it should return the same metadata information. Generally this method is called only once.

See Also:
Cursor, MetaDataProvider

Method Summary
 M getMetaData()
          Returns the metadata information for this metadata-cursor.
 
Methods inherited from interface xxl.core.cursors.Cursor
close, hasNext, next, open, peek, remove, reset, supportsPeek, supportsRemove, supportsReset, supportsUpdate, update
 

Method Detail

getMetaData

M getMetaData()
Returns the metadata information for this metadata-cursor. The return value of this method can be an arbitrary kind of metadata information, e.g., relational metadata information, therefore it is defined as a generic type. When using a metadata-cursor, it has to be guaranteed, that all elements contained in this metadata-cursor refer to the same metadata information. That means, every time getMetaData is called on a metadata-cursor, it should return exactly the same metadata information.

Specified by:
getMetaData in interface MetaDataProvider<M>
Returns:
an object representing metadata information for this metadata-cursor.
